26 const double QtCtrlGUI::time_step = .2;
27 
28 // Asks in a dialog for a set of doubles, and returns it.
29 // Parameter nb_lines the number of lines in the dialog,
30 // nb_col the number of columns in the dialog,
31 // nameVal the array of names displayed,
32 // isGreek the array indicating wether name is in Greek,
33 // val the array of doubles to get from the user.
34 // Precondition the arrays need to have at least nb_lines x nb_col
35 // elements, or a segmentation violation may arrise.
36 void QtCtrlGUI::getDoubleArray(const int nb_lines, const int nb_col,
37  const char* nameVal[],
38  const bool isGreek[], double val[]) {
39  const int nbVal = nb_lines * nb_col;
40  QDialog dialog(this); // the dialog
41  dialog.setModal(true);
42  QWidget values_wdgt(&dialog); // the values widget
43  QVBoxLayout dialog_layout(&dialog); // dialog layout (vertic.)
44  QGridLayout values_layout(&values_wdgt); // values layout (grid)
45  QLineEdit *valBox = new QLineEdit[nbVal]; // its value boxes
46  QDoubleValidator doubleValid(&values_wdgt); // they take doubles
47  int idx;
48  for(idx = 0; idx < nbVal; idx++) { // fills the widget
49  const int lg = idx / nb_col, col = 2 * (idx % nb_col);
50  char name[25]; // text label: emphasize if not greek
51  sprintf(name, "%s%s%s", isGreek[idx] ? "<span>" : "<em>",
52  nameVal[idx], isGreek[idx] ? "</span>:" : "</em>:");
53  values_layout.addWidget(new QLabel( tr(name) ), lg, col);
54  valBox[idx].setText( QString("%L1").arg(val[idx]) );
55  valBox[idx].setValidator(&doubleValid); // accepts only double
56  values_layout.addWidget(&valBox[idx], lg, col + 1);
57  } // end of for (each value)
58  dialog_layout.addWidget(&values_wdgt); // add the values widget
59  QPushButton ok_btn( tr("Ok") ); // OK button closes the dialog
60  connect( &ok_btn, SIGNAL( clicked() ), &dialog, SLOT( close() ) );
61  dialog_layout.addWidget(&ok_btn); // adds it at the bottom
62  dialog.exec(); // shows the dialog and waits until it closes
63  for(idx = 0; idx < nbVal; idx++) // extracts the values
64  val[idx] = valBox[idx].text().toDouble(); // from the boxes
65  delete[] valBox;
66 } // end of Config QtCtrlGUI::getConfig() const ----------------------

68 /* The constructor requires <tt>main()</tt>'s arguments (they can
69  * be forwarded by the @ref ROSnode "ROS node" to ROS).
70  *
71  * Parameter argc the arguments' count,
72  * argv the arguments' value,
73  * parent the main widget parent, if any (optional).
74  *
75  * See ROSnode::ROSnode().
76  */
77 QtCtrlGUI::QtCtrlGUI(const int argc, char** argv, QWidget* parent)
78  : QMainWindow(parent), menu_bar(this), app_menu(&menu_bar),
79  help_menu(&menu_bar), tool_bar(this), start_stop_action(this),
80  about_action(this), about_Qt_action(this), ROS_server(this),
81  motion_model(-.5, .5, M_PI/4, -.6, .5, -M_PI/8, M_PI/8),
82  controller( new NoCtrl(motion_model) ), ctrl_node(argc, argv),
83  ctrl_wdgt( new ViewCtrlWdgt(*this, *controller, motion_model) ),
84  display(*this), logs(this) { // setup the UI
85  setWindowTitle( tr("ROS - Qt Controlers Benchmark") );
86  setWindowIcon( QIcon(":/files/icon.png") );
87  // set the Start, "About Qt Ctrl" and "About Qt" actions
88  start_stop_action.setText( tr("Start Ctrl") );
89  start_stop_action.setShortcut(Qt::Key_S);
90  connect( &start_stop_action, SIGNAL( triggered() ),
91  this, SLOT( buttonStartStop() ) );
92  about_action.setText( tr("About Qt &Ctrl") );
93  connect( &about_action, SIGNAL( triggered() ),
94  this, SLOT( actionAbout() ) );
95  about_Qt_action.setText( tr("About &Qt") );
96  connect( &about_Qt_action, SIGNAL( triggered() ),
97  qApp, SLOT( aboutQt() ) );
98  // set the menu bar and the menus
99  setMenuBar(&menu_bar);
100  app_menu.setTitle( tr("&App") );
101  app_menu.addAction(&start_stop_action);
102  menu_bar.addMenu(&app_menu);
103  help_menu.setTitle( tr("&Help") );
104  help_menu.addAction(&about_action);
105  help_menu.addAction(&about_Qt_action);
106  menu_bar.addMenu(&help_menu);
107  // set the tool bar and add start button
108  addToolBar(&tool_bar);
109  tool_bar.addAction(&start_stop_action);
110  // set the main widget, with teleoperation and logging
111  QWidget *central_widget = new QWidget(this);
112  setCentralWidget(central_widget);
113  // create a layout for the central widget
114  QGridLayout *central_layout = new QGridLayout(central_widget);
115  central_layout->addWidget(&( ctrl_wdgt->widget() ), 0, 0);
116  central_layout->addWidget(&display, 0, 1);
117  QGroupBox *log_box = new QGroupBox(tr("Logs"), central_widget);
118  QBoxLayout *log_layout = // create a layout for the log box
119  new QBoxLayout(QBoxLayout::LeftToRight, log_box);
120  logs.setMinimumSize(400, 100);
121  log_layout->addWidget(&logs);
122  central_layout->addWidget(log_box, 1, 0, 1, 2);
123  // restore the settings
124  readSettings();
125  // initialises the state's display
126  ctrl_wdgt->updateState( State() );
127  // idem for the commands
128  ctrl_wdgt->updateCommands(0, 0);
129  // connects log signal of the ROS node to the GUI method
130  logs.setModel(&( ctrl_node.loggingModel() ) );
131  connect( &(ctrl_node), SIGNAL( loggingUpdated() ),
132  this, SLOT( updateLogging() ) );
133  // needed after Q_DECLARE_METATYPE and before the connects
134  qRegisterMetaType<State>();
135  connectCtrl(); // connects the controller signals to the GUI methods
136 } // end of QtCtrlGUI::QtCtrlGUI(int, char**, QWidget*) --------------

138 // Load up Qt program settings at startup.
139 void QtCtrlGUI::readSettings() {
140  QSettings settings("Qt-Ros Package", "qt_ctrl");
141  restoreGeometry(settings.value("geometry").toByteArray());
142  restoreState(settings.value("windowState").toByteArray());
143  QString master_url = settings.value
144  ("master_url",QString("http://192.168.1.2:11311/")).toString();
145  QString host_url = settings.value
146  ("host_url", QString("192.168.1.3")).toString(); /*
147  //QString topic_name = settings.value
148  //("topic_name", QString("/chatter")).toString();
149  ui.line_edit_master->setText(master_url);
150  ui.line_edit_host->setText(host_url);
151  //ui.line_edit_topic->setText(topic_name);
152  bool remember = settings.value("remember_settings", false).toBool();
153  ui.checkbox_remember_settings->setChecked(remember);
154  bool checked = settings.value("use_environment_variables", false).toBool();
155  ui.checkbox_use_environment->setChecked(checked);
156  if ( checked ) {
157  ui.line_edit_master->setEnabled(false);
158  ui.line_edit_host->setEnabled(false);
159  //ui.line_edit_topic->setEnabled(false);
160  } */
161 } // end of void QtCtrlGUI::readSettings() ---------------------------

163 // Save Qt program settings when closing.
164 void QtCtrlGUI::writeSettings() {
165  QSettings settings("Qt-Ros Package", "qt_ctrl"); /*
166  settings.setValue("master_url",ui.line_edit_master->text());
167  settings.setValue("host_url",ui.line_edit_host->text());
168  //settings.setValue("topic_name",ui.line_edit_topic->text());
169  settings.setValue("use_environment_variables",QVariant
170  (ui.checkbox_use_environment->isChecked()));
171  settings.setValue("geometry", saveGeometry());
172  settings.setValue("windowState", saveState());
173  settings.setValue("remember_settings",QVariant
174  (ui.checkbox_remember_settings->isChecked()));
175  */
176 } // end of void QtCtrlGUI::writeSettings() --------------------------

178 // Method activated by the "About" menu item (not yet used).
179 void QtCtrlGUI::actionAbout() {
180  QMessageBox::about
181  (this, tr("About ROS-Qt Control GUI"),
182  tr("<h2>ROS-Qt Control GUI</h2>\
183  <p>Copyright <a href=\"http://members.loria.fr/AScheuer\"\
184  >Alexis Scheuer</a>, <a href= \
185  \"http://www.univ-lorraine.fr\">UL</a>|<a href= \
186  \"http://fst.univ-lorraine.fr\">FST</a> &amp; <a href=\
187  \"http://www.loria.fr\">Loria</a></p> \
188  <p>This package proposes several controllers for ROS \
189  with a Qt GUI, in order to compare them.</p>"));
190 } // end of void QtCtrlGUI::actionAbout() ----------------------------
191 
193 void QtCtrlGUI::buttonStartStop() {
194  bool not_connected, trying, tracking;
195  start_stop_action.setEnabled(false);// prevent the button activation
196  if ( ctrl_node.connected() ) { // stop the control
197  ctrl_node.end(); // stop ROS node (= server + ctrl)
198  if ( ROS_server.isRunning() ) {
199  const QMessageBox::StandardButton ans = QMessageBox::question
200  (this, tr("Stopping ROS master?"), // title of the dialog
201  tr("Should this GUI stop the TurtleBot simulation "
202  "(you may not be able to start it again)?"),
203  // 3 buttons, Cancel is the default
204  QMessageBox::Yes | QMessageBox::No, QMessageBox::No);
205  if (ans == QMessageBox::Yes)
206  ROS_server.stop(); // stop ROS server's thread
207  } // en of if (ROS server is running)
208  start_stop_action.setText( tr("Start Ctrl") );
209  } else { // start the control
210  do { /* ask, then connect */
211  const QMessageBox::StandardButton ans = QMessageBox::question
212  (this, tr("How to connect to ROS?"), // title of the dialog
213  tr("Should this GUI start a TurtleBot simulation, as well "
214  "as the control node? Choosing \"No\" means you have "
215  "started manually ROS, letting the GUI launching the "
216  "control node, while \"Cancel\" aborts both launch (ROS "
217  "and control)."), // 3 buttons, Cancel is the default
218  QMessageBox::Yes | QMessageBox::No | QMessageBox::Cancel,
219  QMessageBox::Cancel);
220  trying = (ans != QMessageBox::Cancel); // trying = not abort
221  if (ans == QMessageBox::Yes) { // ask which workspace to use
222  const QMessageBox::StandardButton ans = QMessageBox::question
223  (this, tr("Which workspace to use?"), // title of the dialog
224  tr("Should the simulation use the empty workspace (or "
225  "the default one)?"), // 3 buttons, Yes is the default
226  QMessageBox::Yes | QMessageBox::No | QMessageBox::Cancel,
227  QMessageBox::Yes);
228  trying = (ans != QMessageBox::Cancel);
229  if (trying) { // start ROS
230  ROS_server.setEmptyWorkspace(ans == QMessageBox::Yes);
231  ROS_server.start();
232  // previous call returns immediatly, but needs...
233  ROS_server.sleep(5); // ... about 5 s to be effective
234  } // end of if (start ROS)
235  } // end of if (ask which workspace to use)
236  if (trying) { // ask for controller's category
237  const QMessageBox::StandardButton ans = QMessageBox::question
238  (this, tr("Which category of controller to use?"), // title
239  tr("Should the robot track a trajectory "
240  "(or generate one)?"), // 3 buttons, Yes is the default
241  QMessageBox::Yes | QMessageBox::No | QMessageBox::Cancel,
242  QMessageBox::Yes);
243  trying = (ans != QMessageBox::Cancel);
244  tracking = (ans == QMessageBox::Yes);
245  if (trying) { // ask for trajectory or control file
246  char inputType[20];
247  sprintf(inputType, "%s File", tracking ? "Trajectory"
248  : "Accelerations");
249  QString fileType = tr("CSV File (*.csv *.txt)"),
250  inputFile = QFileDialog::getOpenFileName
251  (this, tr(inputType), "", fileType),
252  saveFile = QFileDialog::getSaveFileName
253  (this, tr("Motion Output File"), "", fileType);
254  // memorize old pointers before reallocation (free later)
255  Controller* old_ctrl = controller;
256  ControlWidget* old_wdgt = ctrl_wdgt;
257  if ( (! inputFile.isNull() ) && (! inputFile.isEmpty() ) ) {
258  // using a variable DOES NOT WORK (gets *%!$ incorrect value)
259  /* const char *fileName = inputFile.toStdString().c_str(); */
260  // valid traj/ctrl file => imitate or file controller
261  if (tracking) { // ask for the starting configuration
262  static const int nb_val = 3; // config. -> 3 values
263  static const char* name_val[nb_val]
264  = {"x", "y", "&theta;"};
265  static const bool val_Greek[nb_val]
266  = {false, false, true};
267  double val[nb_val] = {0, 0, 0};
268  getDoubleArray(1, nb_val, name_val, val_Greek, val);
269  val[2] = Object::deg2rad(val[2]); // angle: deg.->rad.
270  const Config start(Point(val[0], val[1]), val[2]);
271  // ask which tracking controller
272  QDialog select_dialog(this);
273  select_dialog.setWindowTitle
274  ( tr("Select a tracking controller") );
275  QDialogButtonBox select_wdgt(Qt::Horizontal);
276  QVBoxLayout dialog_layout(&select_dialog);
277  dialog_layout.addWidget(&select_wdgt);
278  static const int nb_btn = 3;
279  QPushButton select_btn[nb_btn];
280  static const char* name_btn[nb_btn]
281  = {"Analytical", "PID", "Imitate"};
282  int idx;
283  for(idx = 0; idx < nb_btn; idx++) {
284  select_btn[idx].setText( tr(name_btn[idx]) );
285  select_btn[idx].setAutoExclusive(true);
286  select_btn[idx].setCheckable(true);
287  select_btn[idx].setChecked(idx == 0);
288  select_btn[idx].setDefault(idx == 0);
289  // select a button closes the dialog (does not work)
290  select_wdgt.addButton(&select_btn[idx],
291  QDialogButtonBox::AcceptRole);
292  // add a connect
293  connect( &select_btn[idx], SIGNAL( clicked() ),
294  &select_dialog, SLOT( close() ) );
295  }
296  select_dialog.exec();
297  for(idx = 0; (idx < nb_btn) &&
298  ( !select_btn[idx].isChecked() ); idx++) ;
299  // std::cout << "Selection: " << idx << std::endl;
300  static const int nb_coef = 6;
301  static const double h_coef = 1 / 0.35; // from [DP96]
302  const double time_coef = 1 / time_step;
303  double coef[nb_coef] =
304  { h_coef * h_coef, h_coef, 0,
305  time_coef * time_coef, time_coef, 0 };
306  if (idx == 1) {
307  static const char* name_coef[nb_coef]
308  = { "Prop_trans", "Integ_trans", "Deriv_trans",
309  "Prop_rot", "Integ_rot", "Deriv_rot" };
310  static const bool coef_Greek[nb_coef]
311  = {false, false, false, false, false, false};
312  getDoubleArray(2, nb_coef / 2, name_coef,
313  coef_Greek, coef);
314  }
315  TrackingCtrl *new_ctrl = // needed for trajectory()
316  idx == 0 ? (TrackingCtrl*) new AnalyticCtrl
317  ( motion_model, time_step,
318  inputFile.toStdString().c_str(), start )
319  : idx == 1 ? (TrackingCtrl*) new PIDCtrl
320  ( motion_model, time_step,
321  inputFile.toStdString().c_str(), start, coef )
322  : (TrackingCtrl*) new ImitateCtrl
323  ( motion_model, time_step,
324  inputFile.toStdString().c_str(), start );
325  controller = new_ctrl; // this is Controller*
326  display.addTrajectory( new_ctrl->trajectory() );
327  } else controller = new FileCtrl
328  ( motion_model, time_step,
329  inputFile.toStdString().c_str() );
330  ctrl_wdgt =
331  new ViewCtrlWdgt(*this, *controller, motion_model);
332  } else { // invalid control file => keyboard controller
333  KbdCtrl* new_ctrl = new KbdCtrl(motion_model, time_step);
334  controller = new_ctrl; // this one is Controller*
335  ctrl_wdgt = new TeleopWidget(*this, *new_ctrl,
336  motion_model);
337  } // end of else (keyboard controller)
338  connectCtrl(); // connects controller signals to GUI methods
339  hide(); // hide the window before modifying it
340  // add the new control widget to the main window
341  QGridLayout *central_layout =
342  (QGridLayout*)( centralWidget()->layout() );
343  old_wdgt->widget().hide(); // remove not enough, hide needed
344  central_layout->removeWidget( &( old_wdgt->widget() ) );
345  central_layout->addWidget(&( ctrl_wdgt->widget() ), 0, 0);
346  show(); // show/redraw window once modifications are done
347  // change has been done, let's free old pointers
348  delete old_wdgt;
349  delete old_ctrl;
350  // valid save file => set it
351  if ( (! saveFile.isNull() ) && (! saveFile.isEmpty() ) )
352  display.setOutput( saveFile.toStdString().c_str() );
353  ctrl_node.init(*controller); // try to start control node
354  not_connected = ! ctrl_node.connected();
355  } // end of else (choose operating controller)
356  } // end of if (trying)
357  } while (trying && not_connected);
358  if (trying) start_stop_action.setText( tr("Stop Ctrl") );
359  } // end of else (start control)
360  start_stop_action.setEnabled(true);
361 } // end of void QtCtrlGUI::buttonStart() ----------------------------

363 
375 int main(int argc, char** argv) {
376  QApplication app(argc, argv); // start the Qt main loop
377  QtCtrlGUI ctrl(argc, argv); // create the Qt control main window
378  ctrl.show(); // show this window
379  // stop the Qt main loop when last window (= main window) is closed
380  app.connect(&app, SIGNAL(lastWindowClosed()), &app, SLOT(quit()));
381  return app.exec(); // return Qt main loop's return value
382 } // end of int main(int, char**) ------------------------------------
